meanings.definition: To cut or clip with small, quick strokes.
meanings.sent1: She was snipping the paper carefully with scissors.
meanings.sent2: The hairdresser was snipping away at my hair to give me a new style.
meanings.sent3: The tailor kept snipping at the fabric, making it look like a piece of art.
meanings.sent4: The chef was snipping herbs from the garden to add flavor to the dish.
meanings.sent5: The sound of snipping echoed through the room as the students worked on their crafts.

meanings.definition: A small piece that has been cut off.
meanings.sent1: I found a snipping of fabric on the floor from the sewing project.
meanings.sent2: The snipping of the flower was placed in a vase to brighten up the room.
meanings.sent3: The little girl proudly showed off her snipping of colored paper from art class.
meanings.sent4: The snipping of the cake was just enough for everyone to have a taste.
meanings.sent5: He kept a snipping of the newspaper article as a reminder of the event.
